questions.question_text:
You start a managed server by running a start script at the command line. The server fails to start. To troubleshoot this failure, you look at the window in which the script ran. One of the messages from the server says: "boot identity not valid".
What do you do before running the script again?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The answer is B

choices.C: Update the credentials in the start script
choices.A: Add the option to the start script that allows servers to be started without credentials
choices.B: Update the credentials in the boot identity file
choices.D: Create a boot identity username and password by using the administration console
choices.E: The boot identity file does not exist. Create one.

questions.question_text: You are responsible for installing and setting up WebLogic Server to support the development, testing, and production of an application. Each phase of the application's life cycle has different scalability, performance, and security requirements. How will you implement this?

discussion.content: Standalone Server Domain: For development or test environments, you may want to deploy a single application and server independently from servers in a production domain. In this case, you can deploy a simple domain consisting of a single server instance that acts as an Administration Server that, and also hosts the applications you are developing. The wl_server domain that you can install with WebLogic Server is an example of a standalone server domain.

comments.content: So I think it is B

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The domain's requirements are different, that are security and operation mode, therefor i believe that D is the correct answare
Ans can be C as well. Because for all dev, testing we usually have one domain created. Then we can scale , tune this particular domain accordingly by creating clusters, more managed servers etc.
I guess it is D. One domain in develoment mode, another for testing and finally the prod environment.

choices.B: Create a single domain with three administration servers
choices.A: Create a single domain with three clusters
choices.C: Create a single domain with three managed servers

questions.question_text:
Consider a domain that includes a Node Manager home directory. One way to enroll each Node Manager with your domain is with the WLST command nmEnroll().
Select the two scenarios where you do not need to use this command to perform the same task? (Choose two.)

choices.B: You create a managed server template by using the pack utility. Then create the domain by using the unpack utility on the new machine where Node Manager will run
choices.D: Use the script enrollNodeManager.sh found under the WEBLOGIC_HOME directory in server/bin
choices.C: Use the administration console. Select the machine, then the Configuration and Node Manager tabs. Select "Enroll with the Domain." Save and activate your changes
choices.A: The Node Manager is on the machine where the domain was created by using the Configuration Wizard

questions.question_text: The Configuration Wizard has a Node Manager option which, if selected, allows you to also configure a Node Manager as you create your domain. Select two true statements about using the Configuration Wizard to configure Node Manager. (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A and B

choices.D: After the Configuration Wizard creates the domain, it automatically starts the configured Node Manager
choices.B: You are allowed to choose the location of the Node Manager home
choices.C: You can select either the Java-based or script-based Node Manager
choices.A: You are required to enter the username and password for accessing Node Manager

questions.question_text: Over time your server log files have increased in size to over 500 MB. Identify three techniques to help decrease the size of these log files. (Choose three.)

choices.D: Create and use a custom log filter
choices.B: Redirect standard output to the log

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
B makes no sense for decreasing the file size of a log, so it is surely CDE
C,D,E are corrects. By filtering you can block certain messages to be stored so that your log will not increase as much as it is originally.
